learning_outcomes.description: Define and explain evidence-based public health, evidence-based medicine and the research process
Find, evaluate and synthesise peer-reviewed, evidenced-based information relevant to public health to guide the development of health interventions
Formulate and articulate a health research question based on an identified gap in the literature, with a focus on population health
Develop an appropriate health research design that meets ethical requirements
Synthesise and articulate public health research findings to inform policy, practice, or community-based interventions.
Demonstrate effective written and oral communication skills, and teamwork skills, to collaborate with multidisciplinary teams and convey public health insights to diverse audiences

assessments.assessment_title: Assessment 1: Infographic - EBM vs EBPH Explainer
assessments.task_description:
An infographic will inform a general audience about evidence-based medicine and evidence-based public health, encouraging them to incorporate evidence into their professional practice.

The infographic must be submitted via the Turnitin link on the course Blackboard site.

Further details are provided in the Task Sheet on the course Blackboard site.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
This assessment task requires students to develop a specific research question, construct a search strategy and then write an annotated bibliography for the five (5) best papers that are relevant to their topic. The outputs of this assessment task will be sued as the foundation for completion of Assessment task 4: Research proposal. 

The Task sheet is available on the course site.

The literature review must be submitted using the Turnitin link on the course site.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
For this assessment, students will be required to complete an online quiz, which will test their understanding of concepts covered in the relevant lectures and tutorials.

Further information will be provided on the course site.
assessments.submission_guidelines: For this assessment, students will be required to complete an online quiz, which will test their understanding of concepts covered in the relevant lectures and tutorials.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
Following on from the annotated bibliography in Assessment 2, groups of students will take a gap they identified, refine their research question, and outline a research design suitable to collect data to find out more information about their topic. They are then to construct a summary of their proposed research and an information and consent sheet suitable to circulate to potential research participants.

The co-developed research proposal will be presented in tutorials in Weeks 12 and 13.

Further information is available in the Task sheet provided on the course site.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.
